title: What the heck just happened?!
body:
FIXED

I was playing just playing a game. It's probably still going on as I'm typing this, but I was having all kinds of disconnects and lag throughout the game. I didn't think much of this, I just thought it was one of those days, and it's probably unrelated to the real problem.

Then it finally stabilized and we were winning. I was about to charge into the enemy Ahri then the screen freezes and I get the message League of Legends has stopped working. I was tempted to throw my mouse across the room, but I resisted and just tried to reconnect. It wouldn't start. I then thought my task bar was having issues so I tried to find it in my files and start again. Then I realized league of legends was deleted from my computer! I'm not kidding! My lol file that I created was empty, I even tried to search for league in my files, there is zilch. I'm reinstalling right now.

How could this happen? I had a rocky start, but it wasn't out of the ordinary. Then suddenly it all just disappears while I'm in a game. I know this sounds crazy, but it's true.

Update. My storage driver is missing! It's not a bug, my storage driver is gone from my laptop. Ok I solved the problem. I just needed to reboot. Apparently It wasn't detecting my storage drive, and that fixed it. So I guess ignore this thread.

replies.body:
First, a shortcut is not the game.

Check "C:/Riot Games" on windows.

Most likely you have some trash antivirus, get rid of it and just use whatever is built in - neither will protect you from anything you let in, anyway.
No, I checked that. Nothing was there. As for the anti-virus, I don't really know how that would delete a application from my game.

> [{quoted}](name=Mandalorian 117,realm=NA,application-id=LqLKtMpN,discussion-id=JEEWdEwh,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2017-12-20T22:01:32.497+0000)
>
> No, I checked that. Nothing was there. As for the anti-virus, I don't really know how that would delete a application from my game.

Some AVs will panic and quarantine random programs, but typically only the exe.

I know for sure that LoL itself does not even have the capability to delete itself completely - even the uninstaller leaves some files behind, like screenshots.

I figured it out. Somehow one of my laptop couldn't connect to one of my storage drives. I just needed to reboot and everything was fine. I don't know how it did that, and I really hope it doesn't happen again, but at least I found a fix.
